result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas Steven Rowley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nicholas Steven Rowley is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nicholas Steven Rowley was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B", Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Installment Payment Agreement for Fine or Forfeiture.
Pay $100 per month beginning 03-03-17 Failure to pay will be one day in jail for every $50 or part thereof that remains unpaid with Huber consecutive to any other time being served.

Nicholas Steven Rowley, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Guy Mason Taylor.
Craig Nolen appeared as prosecuting attorney. Defendant pleads no contest to count 1, count 2 is dismissed on states motion pursuant to plea agreement. Use of a dangerous weapon allegation on count 1 is stricken pursuant to plea agreement. Court sentenced to pay $200 plus costs.

Nicholas Steven Rowley, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Guy Mason Taylor.
Jeffrey Duane Kohl appeared as prosecuting attorney.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 3, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on January 3, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Nicholas Steven Rowley, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Guy Mason Taylor.
Jeffrey Duane Kohl appeared as prosecuting attorney.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Jeffrey Duane Kohl appeared as prosecuting attorney.

Jeffrey Duane Kohl appeared as prosecuting attorney.

Nicholas Steven Rowley, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Guy Mason Taylor.
Jeffrey Duane Kohl appeared as prosecuting attorney. Waives preliminary hearing,   Defendant stands mute, Court enters not guilty plea on defendants behalf. Matter set for DA Pre-trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Violation: Disorderly Conduct, False Imprisonment
Issuing Agency: Green County Sheriff
Conditions: May not possess any firearms or dangerous weapons.  NO CONTACT WITH: A.M.G., except third party contact to arrange child visitation.   No contact with residence at: N3109 Cty OK, Brodhead WI 53520

Nicholas Steven Rowley, defendant appeared in Court by video means from Green County Jail with counsel Guy Mason Taylor.
Jeffrey Duane Kohl appeared as prosecuting attorney.   Court advises defendant of rights. Defendant given complaint. Defendant waives reading of complaint. Court advises defendant of charges and penalties.
